Pre-Game Insights: The Charlotte Hornets have been ice-cold as they've lost 17 of their last 18 games overall and they will be hoping to snap a nine-game losing streak after falling just short to the Pistons in a 98-94 road defeat on Friday.

The Cleveland Cavaliers have been on an absolute tear as they've reeled off 13 wins from their past 14 games and they will be gunning for a 10th straight victory after blowing past the Mavericks in a 134-122 road win on Friday.
The Hornets are still missing the injured LaMelo Ball, while the Cavaliers are still missing Isaac Okoro, and they have Sam Merrill as questionable for this one.
Losing streak meets winning streak as the lowly Hornets attempt to take down the surging Cavaliers, who have barely missed a step over the past three weeks.
